log: [Concept] Initially conflated concurrency with parallelism; after timeline + interleaving demo, can now define both distinctly but still occasionally says “simultaneous” for concurrency.
[Vocabulary] Uses “thread” vs “process” more accurately; flagged a mix-up once when describing address space sharing.
[Examples] Can explain UI responsiveness (concurrency) vs matrix multiply on multiple cores (parallelism).
[Next] Write two 3-sentence rationales (one concurrency, one parallelism) for a feature you built to strengthen articulation.
[Workflow] Missed one in-class poll submission window; later submitted within 24h (half credit).
[Habits] Set calendar reminder + shortcut to the Google Form; zero misses in last 3 sessions.
[Quality] Answers align with lecture content; short justifications improved from 1-liners to 2–3 evidence-based sentences.
[Next] Keep the reminder; add a 2-bullet recap after each poll to turn admin tasks into micro-learning.
[Mental model] Understands that Decorator adds behavior at runtime without subclass explosion.
[Pitfall] Still tends to reach for inheritance first when stacking cross-cutting features (e.g., logging + auth + caching).
[Recognition] Correctly identifies Java Collections wrappers (`unmodifiableList`, `synchronizedList`) as decorators.
[Next] Implement a `Reader` pipeline: base reader → buffering decorator → metrics decorator; write a 3-line trade-off note vs inheritance.
